item.title: Neighbour called abuse line to report mother accused of daughter's neglect, court hears
item.description: A former neighbour of a mother standing trial accused of criminally neglecting her daughter tried to report concerns to an abuse line, but her call went unanswered, a court has heard.

item.title: New images show Chinese flotilla with formidable firepower in Philippine Sea
item.description: Private firm Starboard Maritime Intelligence says it has used satellite technology to track down the People's Liberation Army Navy task group.

item.title: Rise in threats by sovereign citizens sparks call for Victorian judges to receive security allowance
item.description: A report tabled in state parliament has recommended judicial officers be paid an allowance to increase their personal security.

item.title: Principal allegedly stabbed by staff member at Keysborough Secondary College in Melbourne
item.description: The stabbing happened on the school grounds of Keysborough Secondary College about 3pm.

item.title: Optus reveals nearly half a million phones may be unable to dial Triple Zero
item.description: The figure has been provided to a Senate estimates hearing, where the media regulator appeared on Tuesday.

item.title: Parkway Drive's Park Waves festival cancelled ahead of 2026 Australian debut
item.description: Park Waves festival, set for February 2026, has been cancelled amid economic challenges, joining a growing list of scrapped Australian music events.

item.title: Queensland man Brett Daniel Taylor charged with assisted suicides of three people granted bail
item.description: A Queensland man charged with assisting the suicides of three people has successfully applied for bail.

item.title: Katherine university campus confirmed as site of prison work camp to house at least 130 inmates
item.description: The Northern Territory government has signed a deal to build a new "open-security" prison work camp at Charles Darwin University's Katherine campus, with the facility expected to house at least 130 prisoners.

item.title: Ravensthorpe deputy shire president Mark Mudie killed in West River fire
item.description: A farmer who died trying to stop a "treacherous" fire from destroying his family's property in WA's south is identified as the local town's deputy shire president.

item.title: Review into incident at Tasmania's Ashley Youth Detention Centre of makeshift spit hood on detainee's head tabled in parliament
item.description: An incident at a Tasmanian youth detention centre where a detainee had an improvised spit hood put over his head while being transported by a contracted security company, has been criticised for being "entirely incompatible" with human rights.

item.title: Three deaths related to asbestos exposure at former ABC site
item.description: Staff at the former ABC studios in Elsternwick were exposed to asbestos over an extended period.

item.title: Singapore-based firm scraps Darwin hotel project after sacred site fight
item.description: A $100 million luxury hotel planned for the Darwin Waterfront has fallen through, after concerns were raised by Larrakia traditional owners over its interference with a sacred site.

item.title: Employees ponder bleak Christmas after sudden collapse of caravan manufacturer Zone RV
item.description: Questions are being asked about why Zone RV fell into administration, leaving hundreds of workers unemployed and customers in limbo.

item.title: Six prisoners remain in NT watch houses after report exposes 'inhumane' conditions
item.description: Days after acting Northern Territory Ombudsman Bronwyn Haack raised the alarm about "inhumane" conditions in overcrowded police cells, the government says just six inmates remain.

item.title: ACT legislates commitment for public servants to uphold 'Closing the Gap principle' in Australian first
item.description: Senior ACT public servants will soon be required to demonstrate their work towards ending the inequality experienced by First Nations people.

item.title: Government reveals national AI plan to 'serve' Australians
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: WA Electoral Commissioner Robert Kennedy resigns months after problem-plagued state election
item.description: Robert Kennedy tends his resignation as WA electoral commissioner, nine months after a state election that was plagued by issues including long wait-times to vote, and polling booths running out of ballot papers.

item.title: Lemon8 and Yope put on notice as social media age ban targets
item.description: Social media platforms Lemon8 and Yope are put on notice about age limit laws as both apps surge in popularity ahead of a ban for under 16s.

item.title: End to war in Ukraine 'no closer' after US-Russia talks
item.description: The Kremlin says a resolution to the war in Ukraine is "no closer" after a meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and two of Donald Trump's most powerful envoys.

item.title: Japan and China coast guards offer conflicting accounts of incident near disputed islands
item.description: Tokyo and Beijing have given different accounts of the clash as relations between the two countries continue to sour following comments made by Japan's prime minister about Taiwan.

item.title: Imran Khan is alive but suffering psychological strain and isolation in prison, his sister says
item.description: The imprisoned former Pakistani prime minister is visited by one of his sisters for the first time in weeks, providing an update on his health after rumours swirled about his wellbeing.

item.title: Today in history, December 3: Bhopal gas leak kills thousands in world's worst industrial accident
item.description: It started with a cloud of gas in the dead of night, silently submerging the city in a toxic soup. By morning on December 3, 1984, an Indian city awoke to a nightmare.

item.title: Distance quiz: How well do you know your Australian islands?
item.description: Do you know how far away Heard Island is? What about Christmas Island? Try your hand at today's quiz.

item.title: The secret sauce powering the schools punching above their weight in NAPLAN
item.description: Parents can check the latest NAPLAN scores for 10,000 schools across the country on the MySchool website.

item.title: Small businesses losing thousands to fraudulent online chargeback claims
item.description: Frustrated retailers grappling with online shoplifters are calling for better protections from banks, payment providers and regulators.

item.title: Environment Protection Authority to monitor Ballarat Gold Mine amid air pollution concerns
item.description: Ballarat Gold Mine has exceeded national standards for potentially dangerous air pollutants.

item.title: Foo Fighters announce Launceston concert for January
item.description: Foo Fighters, one of the biggest bands in the world, will play just one small Australian city when they travel out here in January.

item.title: Proton therapy cancer unit debacle leads to $US32 million lawsuit
item.description: Seven years ago, cancer patients forced to travel overseas for proton therapy were promised an Australian-based service — but the project collapsed last year and is now at the centre of a multi-million-dollar lawsuit.

item.title: Israel wants buffer zone between occupied Golan Heights and Damascus in peace deal with Syria
item.description: Benjamin Netanyahu demands Syria establish a "demilitarised zone" between the border with the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights and capital Damascus, as part of any possible peace deal with the new Syrian government.

item.title: Australia's longest-running radio show celebrates 80 years of rural storytelling
item.description: Australia's longest-running radio show is celebrating 80 years on air, and while so much has changed in farming and broadcasting, the core of The Country Hour remains the same.

item.title: NSW Police response to Lindy Lucena's fatal bashing to be probed by watchdog
item.description: The independent body in charge of overseeing NSW Police misconduct allegations will today probe the response to Lindy Lucena's fatal bashing in 2023.

item.title: Backpackers and PALM scheme workers scrambling for jobs after Dicky Bill shutdown
item.description: Backpackers and PALM workers in Victoria and Queensland are looking for new jobs following the shock shutdown of Dicky Bill Australia.

item.title: South-East Asian floods leave more than 1 million people homeless across Indonesia and Sri Lanka
item.description: More than 1,300 people are dead and 1.2 million displaced following devastating flooding and landslides in South-East Asia.

item.title: Indonesian diaspora divided over new Global Citizenship visa scheme as new details emerge
item.description: Indonesia's new visa scheme is being touted as a solution to dual citizenship. But some in the Indonesian community say the visa has "no real benefit" and amounts to a government revenue grab.

item.title: Three Paralympians talk about how disability altered their lives in documentary Changing Track
item.description: Filmmaking siblings Tristan and Timothy Kenyon's documentary Changing Track explores how competing in the Paralympics changes lives.

item.title: England cricketing great Robin Smith dies in Perth aged 62
item.description: The cricket world mourns after the death of English batting great Robin Smith in his Perth home.

item.title: Three in four autistic children want to play more sport but avoidable barriers stand in their way
item.description: Hayley masks their struggles so well in dance class that teachers can't tell. But when they get home, they collapse — sometimes missing days of school.

item.title: Gold Coast council's Springbrook cableway edges forward but with slashed funding
item.description: The Gold Coast's long-running cableway proposal has inched forward after councillors redirected funds from First Nations consultation to environmental studies.

item.title: Putin meets US officials at Kremlin for Ukraine talks
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Pete Hegseth defends second US strike on alleged Venezuelan drug boat
item.description: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth defends authorising a follow-up strike on a Venezuelan boat that killed 11 people.

item.title: Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium project set to pass Tasmanian parliament
item.description: A stadium on Hobart's waterfront has gained enough support to pass parliament, after key independents declared they would support the contentious project — as it happened.

item.title: WA Police Arson Squad pinpoint ignition point of Geraldton bushfire that destroyed home
item.description: Police offer up a $25,000 reward as they try to determine the cause of a blaze that tore through 160 hectares of land, left two homes uninhabitable and completely destroyed another in Geraldton.

item.title: Sam Kerr praised in Matildas return as Australia beats New Zealand 2-0
item.description: Sam Kerr makes her long-awaited return to the Matildas on home soil as Australia downs New Zealand 2-0.

item.title: More than 50 couples marry in mass Gaza wedding after two years of Israeli attacks
item.description: Thousands of Palestinians turn out in Gaza's Khan Younis to celebrate the wedding of 54 couples who had been unable to tie the knot during Israel's bombardment of the strip.

item.title: Family unable to move from government housing next to drug den
item.description: A single mother-of-two no longer feels safe in her government-provided housing after her child found a used needle in their backyard.

item.title: Sabrina Carpenter slams White House for using her music in ICE video
item.description: Two-time Grammy winner Sabrina Carpenter slams the White House for using her song in a social media post about ICE raids, telling the Trump administration to never involve her in its "inhumane agenda".

item.title: Football presenter Laura Woods collapses during scary on-air moment
item.description: Laura Woods says she is doing 'OK' after collapsing on-air during an England match.

item.title: Report shows violent attacks and street abuse 'the norm' for Australian Jews, peak body says
item.description: Executive Council of Australian Jewry Alex Ryvchin said the data showed antisemitism remained at "deeply troubling levels".

item.title: Donald Trump says he is terminating any pardons, commutations signed by Biden using autopen
item.description: US President Donald Trump says he is terminating all documents, including pardons, signed by his predecessor Joe Biden using an autopen signature.

item.title: Humanitarian migrants in US fear being deported into danger following shooting
item.description: The Trump administration's escalating restrictions on humanitarian migration are leaving some of the United States's most vulnerable diaspora communities terrified for their futures.

item.title: Data centre spending spree and housing boom drive economic growth
item.description: Australia's economy grew by 0.4 per cent in the September quarter, driven by data centre spending spree and housing boom

item.title: Hopes remain for return of eagles to relocated nest at Bundaberg Hospital site
item.description: A wedge-tailed eagle's nest was moved in an operation costing about $100,000 involving a 60-tonne crane, a specialist arborist and a carefully engineered basket.

item.title: Crystal Fabergé egg shatters record, fetching $46m at auction
item.description: The Winter Egg is made from finely carved rock crystal, covered in a delicate snowflake motif wrought in platinum with 4,500 tiny diamonds.

item.title: Council says warnings ignored about tree removal in Central West Orana REZ
item.description: The NSW government is being accused of wilfully ignoring warnings about the destruction of hundreds of native trees as part of a renewables project.

item.title: Demersal fishing ban announced for commercial, recreational fishers in Perth and WA amid scarce fish stocks
item.description: Strict bans limiting commercial and recreational fishing in Perth and WA are announced in an effort to save some under-threat fish species from the brink of collapse.

item.title: Hugh Jackman and Kate Hudson surprise patrons with impromptu performance at Aussie pub in NYC
item.description: Hugh Jackman sung the crowd-pleaser Sweet Caroline and even climbed onto the top of the bar counter for the performance.

item.title: What time does the Gabba Test start? How to watch the Ashes, and Brisbane weather forecast
item.description: The second Ashes Test is upon us and we have fingers crossed it will last more than two days. Here's everything you need to know.

item.title: Pat Cummins eyeing early return from injury in Gabba Test with Josh Inglis poised for Ashes debut
item.description: Australian skipper Pat Cummins is pushing for an early return from injury in the second Test in Brisbane while Josh Inglis will be making his Ashes debut.

item.title: What led Donald Trump to pardon a foreign leader convicted of helping to flood the US with drugs
item.description: Donald Trump says his country is at war with "narco-terrorists". But he is releasing the former president of Honduras, who was jailed in the US for overseeing one of the world's worst drug conspiracies.

item.title: What happened to Lisa Lynn? The untold story of Greg Lynn's first marriage and his wife's sudden death
item.description: Long before Greg Lynn was convicted of murder in Victoria's High Country, his estranged wife died suddenly at home in Mount Macedon. Now, some of those closest to Lisa Lynn are pushing for the coroner to re-examine her death.

item.title: Bruce Lehrmann loses appeal against failed rape defamation case as lawyer hints at High Court challenge
item.description: Bruce Lehrmann has lost his appeal against a Federal Court ruling that found on the balance of probabilities he raped his then-colleague Brittany Higgins in 2019.

item.title: Government considers offloading retiring Tiger helicopters to Ukraine
item.description: As the United States attempts to broker a peace deal at the Kremlin in Moscow, it is expected a significant funding boost from Canberra to aid Ukraine's war efforts is imminent.

item.title: Michael and Susan Dell donate nearly $10 billion to 'Trump accounts' for children
item.description: Tech billionaires Michael and Susan Dell have pledged $US6.25 billion ($9.5 billion) to new investment accounts for children, known as "Trump accounts". Here's how the donation will work.

item.title: Parents left with PTSD after son's death question post-operative care for people with disabilities
item.description: The parents of a young man with a neuromuscular disease who died seven days after spinal surgery say they have serious concerns about the post-operative care he was provided at Royal Perth Hospital.

item.title: Search for missing flight MH370 to resume this month, Malaysia says
item.description: The search for missing Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 will resume at the end of December, more than a decade after the Beijing-bound flight disappeared.

item.title: Why dating your therapist is almost never OK
item.description: A new code of conduct for for Australian psychologists provides updated guidance that it's almost never OK to date someone who is or has been a client, even if that was years ago.

item.title: Is it better to sleep naked or wear pyjamas in summer?
item.description: What you wear to bed can affect the quality of your sleep. And if that's nothing at all, there are a few things to consider.

item.title: How to prepare yourself and your child for the social media ban on December 10
item.description: From December 10, young people will lose access to part of their online world. Here's how to support them.

item.title: Tasmania's local and state governments to pay $650,000 for Foo Fighters concert in Launceston
item.description: Tasmania's "biggest concert ever" will take place at Launceston's York Park next month when American rock band Foo Fighters play their only Australian show.

item.title: Man killed, two others injured in northern NSW shooting
item.description: A man has died and two others injured following a shooting on a property in Murwillumbah in northern NSW.

item.title: Algal bloom inquiry quizzes health chief about respiratory illness concerns
item.description: South Australia's public health chief says there is a need for more data analysis to determine whether there has been an increase in respiratory illness linked to the state's algal bloom.

item.title: What the latest GDP numbers mean for interest rates and the economy
item.description: Australia's latest economic growth numbers show an economy in generally rude health, but that might result in a rude shock for mortgage borrowers earlier rather than later in 2026.

item.title: Ryan Papenhuyzen unsure if he'll ever return to professional sport after Melbourne Storm exit
item.description: Former Melbourne fullback Ryan Papenhuyzen says his future is a "blank canvas" ahead of a break from professional sport that he admits could end up being permanent.

item.title: Hobart stadium to pass Tasmanian parliament after support from independents
item.description: A stadium on Hobart's waterfront has gained enough support to pass parliament, after independents Casey Hiscutt, Bec Thomas and Tania Rattray declared they would support the contentious project.

item.title: Israeli settler outposts spread among West Bank villages and fuel fear of more attacks during olive harvest
item.description: Palestinian villagers are living in fear, saying that at any time, armed Israeli settlers could descend on them and cause trouble.

item.title: 'Extreme fire danger' forecast across South Australia for Thursday
item.description: The CFS is warning of high fire risk tomorrow with hot and windy conditions forecast, while the BOM has issued a fire weather warning with 'extreme fire danger' for parts of the state.

item.title: Coalition has 'no confidence' social media ban will work under Labor
item.description: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley says Australia's social media ban will not work under Labor, as the federal government rejects YouTube's claim it will make kids "less safe".

item.title: First community-designed, culture-led home from new outback housing initiative arrives in Tennant Creek
item.description: A one-of-a-kind home, designed with the input of Tennant Creek families, has rolled up the Stuart Highway from Adelaide on a convoy of trucks. It is part of a new initiative aiming to transform housing in remote First Nations communities.

item.title: Jodie Hill denies involvement in alleged murder of 72-year-old Dimboola man John Hunter
item.description: A woman on trial for the alleged murder of 72-year-old Victorian man John Hunter tells the Supreme Court she was present when he was attacked but another person was responsible for his death.

item.title: Footballer sacked, youth worker charged after 'last-minute' intel leads to drug drop police sting
item.description: A regional Victorian footballer and youth worker are facing drug trafficking charges after being caught with a package allegedly containing illegal drugs.

item.title: Hobart's AFL stadium vote to pass Tasmania's upper house, but at what cost?
item.description: A stadium on Hobart's waterfront has gained enough support to pass parliament, after key independents declared on Wednesday they would support the contentious project.

item.title: Man with alleged links to 'Afghan crew' accused of lying to get home loan
item.description: Ali Jundi was arrested as part of an investigation into the Alameddine crime family, with police alleging he was part of the "Afghan crew".

item.title: Wikipedia's top 20 articles of 2025 sees Charlie Kirk and Trump head the list
item.description: Wikipedia has released the list of the 20 most-read articles on its English-language site for the year.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: High Court strikes down remote NT public housing rent rises
item.description: A remote rent policy that saw some Northern Territory residents slugged with hikes of up to $300 a fortnight has been struck down on appeal by the High Court.

item.title: Australia's oil refineries will need government support to avoid a reliance on fuel imports
item.description: With just two refineries left and 80 per cent of liquid fuel being imported, experts are warning Australia is increasingly vulnerable to global supply shocks.

item.title: Australia to provide Ukraine with $95m funding boost
item.description: Australia will provide an additional $95 million in military assistance to Ukraine and slap a fresh round of sanctions on ships believed to be part of Moscow's so-called "shadow fleet".

item.title: WA's surrogacy and IVF laws overhauled as legislation passes state parliament
item.description: Same-sex couples, single people, transgender and intersex West Australians will be able to access assisted reproductive technology and surrogacy, almost a decade after reforms were first promised.

item.title: EU's former diplomat Federica Mogherini charged in 'fraud and corruption' probe
item.description: European prosecutors are investigating suspicions of fraud related to an EU-funded training scheme for junior diplomats.

item.title: Three issues reveal Albanese government's record on trust and integrity
item.description: Despite holding a commanding position, Anthony Albanese knows the global trend of sliding trust in government isn't one to be taken lightly.

item.title: Jimmy Barnes: The story behind Working Class Man and his American dream
item.description: Cold Chisel was over. America beckoned. And Jimmy Barnes was terrified. This is the story of the album that made him, and the song that saved him.

item.title: Energy watchdog flags 5 per cent fall in power prices amid renewables surge
item.description: An energy watchdog says more renewable energy is projected to lower prices, but others warn the promise is illusory and more pain is coming.

item.title: One player's case against the world's biggest crypto casino
item.description: Chat logs and gambling data show the tactics used by Australian-run online casino Stake to keep one user hooked.

item.title: Spotify Wrapped 2025: Bad Bunny takes global top artist spot for fourth time
item.description: Spotify Wrapped is back for 2025, with Bad Bunny taking the top spot for global artist for a fourth time.

item.title: Survivors of child sexual abuse face growing National Redress Scheme wait times
item.description: An independent audit of the National Redress Scheme has found wait times are increasing and causing significant distress to survivors of child sexual abuse.

item.title: Here is what we know about the Russia–Ukraine war peace negotiations
item.description: After a flurry of meetings, Russia's war in Ukraine continues. So where is the peace process at?

item.title: Tens of thousands of cars damaged after hailstorms lash Queensland and parts of New South Wales
item.description: Insurers are urging those with damaged cars to make their claims as soon as possible in the aftermath of hailstorms across Queensland and parts of New South Wales.

item.title: NSW council votes to stop flying Indigenous flags and enforce permissions for Welcome to Country
item.description: A mayor in southern NSW says removing the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander flags from council meeting chambers will "promote civic neutrality".

item.title: Australia's teen social media ban unofficially begins today. Here's what you need to know
item.description: Today marks the unofficial start of the teen social media ban. Here's everything you need to know.

item.title: Most renters avoid heating and cooling homes due to costs
item.description: A new report finds that about 70 per cent of renters were avoiding heating and cooling their homes to save money. Some experts and advocates are calling for stronger minimum energy standards across the country.

item.title: Parents, cancer patients say lack of proton therapy in Australia is 'an embarrassment'
item.description: When seven-month-old Evelyn was diagnosed with a rare cancer, her mother was told proton beam therapy would be her daughter's best chance for survival. But the treatment was not available in Australia and still is not three years later.

item.title: New images of Jeffrey Epstein's island released as Ghislaine Maxwell flags bid for freedom
item.description: Democrats say the newly released images provide a "harrowing look" into Jeffrey Epstein's world, as the late sex offender's jailed accomplice, Ghislaine Maxwell, informs a court she is planning to challenge her imprisonment.

item.title: China halts Japanese cultural events after tensions rise over Taiwan remarks
item.description: Beijing halts more than 20 Japanese cultural events across China as its diplomatic spat with Japan escalates.

item.title: Superstar Twiggy on the documentary of her storied life
item.description: For the first time, the much-loved English model, actress and singer tells her own story in a new documentary by Sadie Frost.

item.title: Gold Coast beaches eroded by Cyclone Alfred all open in time for summer holidays
item.description: Severe erosion caused by Cyclone Alfred forced the closure of several beaches in March. Now, extra lifeguards are being recruited as they anticipate a busy summer period.

item.title: Bruce Lehrmann is running out of courts after losing his defamation appeal
item.description: With his defamation appeal dismissed and legal costs rising, Bruce Lehrmann is almost out of options. A High Court bid is possible, but what would it take to get there?

item.title: Study reveals motivations of deepfake image abuse perpetrators
item.description: Confronting accounts give a rare insight into the minds of perpetrators of deepfake image-based abuse, as part of a landmark study.

item.title: Maddy sees the world through a 'glitter jar' but has still become a national tennis champion
item.description: Victorian teenager Maddy Kelly was 11 years old when she started losing her sight. Two years later, she's a national tennis champion.

item.title: Steve Smith says adaptability is Australia's focus heading into the second Ashes Test at the Gabba
item.description: Steve Smith reveals the mindset Australia is taking into the second Test as the Aussies look to go up 2–0 in the Ashes.

item.title: Firefighting aircraft crashes, crews battle bushfire as temperatures soar in Victoria
item.description: Some parts of the state hit 38 degrees Celsius as emergency services manage the risk of bushfire in regional Victoria.

item.title: Homegrown trainee Darrenia Carr helps fill recruitment gap in Tennant Creek art centre
item.description: An apprenticeship program in a remote Northern Territory town is helping businesses find skilled workers by connecting homegrown teens to local employment.

item.title: Aged home care package changes set off cash conflict between providers and suppliers
item.description: Care providers are trying to strongarm cash from suppliers of equipment, including wheelchairs, a month after the federal government reformed home care packages for senior Australians.

item.title: Richard Marles says he is 'working through' AUKUS review from the US – as it happened
item.description: The acting prime minister says the United States is fully supportive of AUKUS and has thanked it for providing a review.

item.title: Tasmanian government looks to revenue raising and state business cutbacks to fund Hobart stadium
item.description: Tasmania's premier and treasurer agree to reduce borrowings for government businesses in an effort to accommodate more debt for the Hobart AFL stadium.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Brisbane-based barrister Matthew Hickey being pursued by ATO over long-standing $2.7 million tax bill
item.description: Brisbane-based lawyer Matthew Hickey has been quietly facing a tax fight, with the Australian Taxation Office (ATO) bill now sitting at about $2.7 million.

item.title: EU proposes using frozen Russian assets as repatriation loans for Ukraine
item.description: Belgium is pushing back on a European proposal to use frozen Russian assets to help financially support Ukraine.

item.title: Wallabies and All Blacks drawn into same group for first time at 2027 Rugby World Cup
item.description: Wallabies coach Joe Schmidt says he is unlikely to be coaching the All Blacks at the World Cup, as Australia and New Zealand are drawn into the same group.

item.title: Risk of 'imminent' RBA rate hike rising, as Australian dollar moves above 66 US cents — as it happened
item.description: A leading economist says the "risk" of an "imminent" RBA interest rate hike is "rising", while former treasurer Peter Costello is urging Australia to arrest its fertility downturn.

item.title: Increasing wait times for mammograms could have 'potentially tragic' consequences
item.description: A Medicare funding freeze and high cost of training new students has left a shortage of workers and blown out wait times of critical diagnostic services.

item.title: Remote community in WA's Pilbara saves $400k of food after truck breaks down
item.description: A mammoth effort by community members saves $400,000 worth of food for the Punmu remote community, but the incident reignites the debate about the condition of WA's most remote roads.

item.title: Raccoon goes on drunken rampage in US liquor store
item.description: The suspect broke into a liquor store in the US state of Virginia, ransacked several shelves and ended up face down in the bathroom.

item.title: Pentagon watchdog finds Hegseth's use of Signal posed risk to US personnel
item.description: A report by the Pentagon watchdog concludes US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated Pentagon policy by using his personal device for official business and recommends better training for all Pentagon officials.

item.title: Western Australia's Payarri people celebrate state's 150th native title determination after 30-year journey
item.description: It was 1994 when Ngalia man Kado Muir first sat down with two of his elders and a lawyer to discuss lodging a native title claim for his ancestral country, Payarri. Today, the Federal Court will make an on-country determination of that claim.

item.title: Hobart stadium get final approval in state's upper house, clearing way for AFL team — as it happened
item.description: The Hobart stadium has received final parliamentary approval, clearing the way for it to be built and the state to claim its own AFL team.

item.title: Cricket fan's mission to crisscross Australia on his yellow Vespa to attend every Ashes Test
item.description: One man, one little yellow Vespa and a 12,000-kilometre road trip to attend every Ashes Test.

item.title: Broome man who killed non-biological brother not guilty of murder due to mental impairment
item.description: A special proceedings hearing in the Supreme Court in Broome heard that Ian Ralph Brooke was suffering from an acute psychotic disorder when he fatally stabbed a 27-year-old in 2023.

item.title: Opal mining to continue on land cut out from new Qld national park, formerly Vergemont Station
item.description: The Queensland government's purchase of Vergemont Station last year led to months of uncertainty for miners with tenures inside the former cattle station, which is larger than the Australian Capital Territory.

item.title: Prada buys Versace, taking control of maximalist label that was once its rival
item.description: With Prada buying Versace, one of fashion's biggest rivalries is over — and it will be hoping to bring the fellow Italian fashion house back into style.

item.title: Indonesian environmentalists blame rapid forest loss in Sumatra for severity of deadly floods
item.description: Indonesia's government says it will summon eight companies over their suspected role in worsening the scale of floods and landslides that have killed more than 700 people. But environmental groups say authorities are hypocritical and partly to blame for the destruction.

item.title: Former NT administrator, musician and author Ted Egan dies aged 93
item.description: Folk music legend, author and former Northern Territory administrator Ted Egan has died aged 93.

item.title: Steve Cropper, legendary guitarist for Booker T and the MG's, dies aged 84
item.description: Steve Cropper, was best known as the guitarist for Booker T and the MG's, but also co-wrote the classics Green Onions, and In the Midnight Hour.

item.title: Neo-Nazi Matthew Gruter leaves Australia after visa revoked by minister
item.description: The South African Neo-Nazi who sparked controversy during a protest outside NSW parliament has left Australia after his visa was revoked.

item.title: Transgender women will no longer be allowed to join two of the UK's leading groups for women and girls
item.description: Two of the UK's leading groups for women and girls will stop offering membership to trans women in the aftermath of a Supreme Court ruling.

item.title: Descendent emotional to see WWI digger in unmarked grave receive recognition
item.description: South Australian high school students have helped to uncover the legacies of five war veterans who were laid to rest in unmarked graves.

item.title: Anti-bullying review recommends making kids 'upstanders'. Does it work?
item.description: Research suggests that actively encouraging students to be 'upstanders' to bullying may even be counterproductive.

item.title: Six Chinese nationals found in Kalumburu detained by immigration officials
item.description: A group of six Chinese nationals are detained by authorities after two of their group were found in WA's remote Kalumburu community by an off-duty police officer.

item.title: Ted Egan reflects on his life in remote communities during a 2007 interview.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Beer box musician, land rights champion and NT administrator Ted Egan's 'big and generous life'
item.description: A former Government House occupant and a prolific author and historian, Ted Egan will also be remembered as the man who reinvented the beer box as a musical instrument.

item.title: Why former Melbourne enforcer Nelson Asofa-Solomona chose boxing over rugby league
item.description: Former Melbourne enforcer Nelson Asofa-Solomona reveals how he fell out of love with rugby league and turned down lucrative contract offers to pursue a career in boxing.

item.title: SA CFS volunteer sentenced for intentionally starting bushfire near Naracoorte
item.description: An 18-year-old who had been a cadet captain in the Country Fire Service admits deliberately lighting a bushfire near Naracoorte, but mental health conditions lower the sentence he might otherwise have been given.

item.title: Ashes 2025 updates: Australia vs England, Joe Root scores century, Mitchell Starc takes six wickets on day one of the second Test in Brisbane
item.description: Joe Root scores the first Ashes century of his career on Australian soil, as Mitchell Starc's 6-71 enlivens a thrilling day of Test cricket.

item.title: Sydney's M4 tunnel shut over fears concrete roofing could fall onto vehicles
item.description: Drivers have been stuck in Sydney's M4 tunnel for several hours over fears part of its concrete roofing could tumble onto traffic.

item.title: Here's what is known about sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's islands in the Caribbean
item.description: Little St James is commonly referred to "Epstein Island" and according to attorneys for his accusers, the island was the site of many crimes committed against underage girls.

item.title: Tasmanian emergency bushfire warning issued for Dolphin Sands, fires at Glenlusk and Levendale downgraded
item.description: A shack has burnt down in a bushfire in Dolphin Sands on Tasmania's east coast, where residents were told to find shelter.

item.title: E-rideables inquiry calls for wide-ranging changes to WA laws, including tougher penalties against riders
item.description: The WA government is urged to toughen penalties for e-rideable offences and punish retailers who help people modify e-rideables to break the rules, after an inquiry sparked by the death of a Perth father.

item.title: Police offer $500k reward for information on toddler Jordan Thompson's overdose death
item.description: NSW police are urging anyone with information about toddler Jordan Thompson's 2005 death to come forward as they increase the reward on offer.

item.title: Father of the baby bonus Peter Costello wants falling fertility rate 'back on the agenda'
item.description: With Australia's fertility rate at a new low and concerns about its economic impact on the future, the former treasurer behind the early 2000s baby boom says all options should be on the table to encourage more children.

item.title: Rory McIlroy starts slowly at Australian Open but proves he is the headline act
item.description: Rory McIlroy knows there is room for improvement after his first round at the Australian Open, as the five-time major champion brings spectators flocking to Royal Melbourne.

item.title: Government will not say if further Australian family members of Islamic State fighters on track to return
item.description: The Coalition seizes on meeting notes from June to claim the government is working to return Australian children and partners of Islamic State fighters.

item.title: Confusion over when gas review will be released
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Cost of living remains a sore point for voters as political year wraps
item.description: A mammoth year in politics ended with a focus on what is worrying most Australians ahead of Christmas: the cost of living.

item.title: Canberra man Michael O'Connell sentenced to 10 years in jail for manslaughter of partner Danielle Jordan
item.description: A Canberra man is sentenced to 10 years in jail for manslaughter, after the ACT Court of Appeal overturned his murder conviction for the death of his partner.

item.title: How to respond to sexual harassment or assault at a work party
item.description: Managers can send strong signals that harassment or assault at the work party will be treated as seriously as in the workplace.

item.title: Wallaroo Mines Primary School students and parents interviewed over ex-principal
item.description: Parents at a South Australian school say they have been left in the dark about photos taken by a principal during a school camp.

item.title: Condoms and contraceptives to become more expensive in China as Beijing accelerates push to lift birth rate
item.description: China is ending a decades-long tax exemption on contraceptives to push up its birth rate. Experts say the change could leave women and young people more vulnerable.

item.title: Thousands of special permits issued to fill nationwide teacher shortage
item.description: Nationally, there is a teacher shortage and one of the measures used to fill the gap is using undergraduates, but that too can have long-lasting impacts.

item.title: Tasmanian minister censured for withdrawing footy club funding after it attended opposition's media event
item.description: Tasmanian parliamentarians have censured a minister for breaking his word to a local football club after it attended an election campaign media event with the opposition.

item.title: Behind the Lines political cartooning exhibition opens in Canberra, awarding Matt Golding the top prize
item.description: The annual showcase of the year's top political cartoons has opened at Old Parliament House in Canberra, depicting the biggest national and global events with satire and wit.

item.title: Marles 'going through' Trump AUKUS review
item.description: Richard Marles says the government has received the Pentagon's much-anticipated review into the $368 billion AUKUS submarine pact, declaring Washington is "fully supportive" of the deal.

item.title: Arthur Higgins, veteran sports broadcaster who also covered the Moon landing and 9/11, dies aged 85
item.description: A sports aficionado whose baritone voice earned him the nickname "Big Daddy", Higgins read the news on Channel Nine, the ABC and a slew of radio stations over the course of his 57 years in the media.

item.title: Bruce Lehrmann sentenced in Tasmanian court for using car without consent
item.description: Bruce Lehrmann has changed his plea to guilty and been sentenced for one count of using a vehicle without the consent of the owner.

item.title: Calls to reinstate organ donation driver's licence scheme
item.description: As the Victorian government moves to bring back the driver's licence donor registration scheme, DonateLife wants it to be nationwide, saying there is clear evidence it leads to an increase in organ donors.

item.title: Rare PNG conjoined twins en route to Australia as case reaches 'critical' point
item.description: A rare set of conjoined twins are being urgently airlifted from Papua New Guinea to Australia, with doctors recommending they be separated as soon as possible.

item.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Alleged manslaughter victim told classmate she was 'treated like a slave' at home, court hears
item.description: A girl who was allegedly criminally neglected at the hands of her mother before she died told a friend she was "treated like a slave" and was "scared to go back home", a court has heard.

item.title: High Court agrees to hear teenagers' challenge to under 16s social media ban
item.description: The High Court of Australia agrees to hear a special case brought by two teenagers challenging the federal government's upcoming social media ban for Australians under 16.

item.title: Hobart’s new stadium likely go ahead
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: George Clooney on the real meaning of courage
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Nathan Lyon's axing leaves Australia struggling on docile Gabba pitch in second Test
item.description: Australia leaves Nathan Lyon out of its XI for the second Ashes Test at the Gabba, marking an almost 14-year first.

item.title: Root notches century despite stunning run-out, non-Starc seamers struggle without Lyon — five quick hits from Ashes second Test day one
item.description: Joe Root overcomes a horror mix-up to notch a long-awaited first Test century in Australia, while Australia's seamers largely struggle without the dropped Nathan Lyon. Here are the quick hits from the first day of the pink-ball Ashes Test in Brisbane.

item.title: Hobart stadium at Macquarie Point gets final approval in parliament's upper house
item.description: A $1.13 billion stadium on the edge of the Hobart CBD has been approved by Tasmania's upper house, satisfying a key condition for the state's AFL licence.

item.title: Putin bears 'moral responsibility' for 2018 poisoning of UK woman, inquiry finds
item.description: A UK public inquiry has concluded that Russian President Vladimir Putin "must have" ordered the Novichok nerve agent attack on Russian double agent Sergei Skripal in 2018.

item.title: Value of private health insurance 'eroding' as doctors urge reform
item.description: A new report from Australia's peak doctors' body says private health insurance is increasingly failing to deliver value to the roughly 15 million Australians who hold a policy.

item.title: FBI arrests suspect over pipe bombs planted ahead of January 6, 2021, US Capitol riot
item.description: The arrest marks the first time investigators have settled on a suspect in an act that had long vexed law enforcement and spawned a multitude of conspiracy theories.

item.title: What does Vladimir Putin wants from his state visit to India and his meeting with Narendra Modi?
item.description: The Russian leader's first state visit to India in nearly four years is expected to focus heavily on trade amid a backdrop of international sanctions and Donald Trump's tariff policy.

item.title: New York Times sues the Pentagon over press access restrictions
item.description: The US publication has filed a lawsuit over a new policy requiring journalists to sign a pledge to refrain from reporting information not authorised for release by the Pentagon.

item.title: Israel to compete at Eurovision Song Contest in 2026, prompting several nations to withdraw
item.description: Public broadcasters in Spain, Ireland and the Netherlands say they will not participate in next year's event and more are expected to follow.

item.title: AUKUS will survive Trump, says Australia's top diplomat in London Stephen Smith
item.description: The trilateral agreement has come under significant scrutiny, but Australia's top diplomat in London says he believes its future is assured.

item.title: Community housing provider HousingFirst defends dual rent rises on newly acquired properties
item.description: Elderly residents in Melbourne's south-east say they are in financial distress after two rent increases, which a community housing organisation says are a necessary move to a standard rent-setting model.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: Blacked-out raccoon, poor strategy call and the PM's wedding
item.description: Think you have had your ears to the ground? It's time to test your knowledge of the week that was.

item.title: The best new TV shows of 2025, from The Golden Bachelor to The Studio
item.description: From a send-up of Hollywood studios to a chilling depiction of violence and masculinity to an age-appropriate reality TV romance, these are our favourite TV shows of 2025.

item.title: Today in History, December 5: How Prohibition was brought down by gangsters, bootleggers and violence
item.description: Prohibition was officially repealed on December 5, 1933. But the beginning of its end can be traced back years earlier — to a highly-publicised massacre by firing squad.

item.title: Victorian prisoners held in police stations for weeks, lawyer says
item.description: A Victorian lawyer says a "crisis" is unfolding in the state's jails, with remand centres so crowded prisoners are instead being kept in police holding cells for up to a month.

item.title: Corowa residents caught off guard by 'early' fire a sign of 'apathy', authorities say
item.description: A fast moving grass fire almost burned through the southern NSW town of Corowa last week. Despite the extreme fire danger rating, residents say they weren't prepared for such an intense fire so early in the season.

item.title: Is Tasmanian AFL team a holy grail or poisoned chalice? Time will tell
item.description: When it comes to the Macquarie Point stadium in Tasmania, there is clearly something deeper at play than seats, concrete and a roof. You simply couldn't vote for it otherwise, writes Chris Rowbottom.

item.title: Education leaders call on News Corp to cease 'harmful' NAPLAN league tables
item.description: Forty-one signatories to an open letter say they are "dismayed" and that school rankings cause "harm to our communities".

item.title: Search engines will soon have to blur porn image results in Australia
item.description: Pornographic image results will be blurred and searches for self-harm information will redirect to mental health supports under new Australian online safety codes.

item.title: Hume League umpire Brodie Taylor
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Teen becomes first nationally accredited netball umpire in a wheelchair
item.description: Brodie Taylor has changed the game of netball by overturning disability preconceptions to become the first person in a wheelchair to attain national netball umpiring accreditation.

item.title: Industrial relations are risky business for the Liberals after WorkChoices
item.description: The Liberals argue Labor's industrial relations concessions to the unions are a "handbrake on productivity" but this area has been tricky for the Coalition since John Howard's disastrous overreach.

item.title: Australia's PALM workers are leaving their employers, becoming 'extremely vulnerable' in visa limbo
item.description: Pacific Islanders have been leaving Australia's guest worker scheme, a decision that breaches their visa conditions and leaves them "extremely vulnerable".

item.title: Israel-aligned anti-Hamas Gaza militia leader Yasser Abu Shabab killed
item.description: Gaza militia leader Yasser Abu Shabab, whose anti-Hamas group had been supported by Israel, has been killed after an attack in southern Gaza.

item.title: Lawyers to face regulators after AI was used to prepare legal document
item.description: Three lawyers will face Australian legal regulators, with one ordered to pay $10,000 in costs, after submitting a legal document prepared with artificial intelligence and found to contain "inaccurate and misleading references".

item.title: Pentagon watchdog releases report on Pete Hegseth's use of Signal app
item.description: The 84-page report finds US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated policy and could have put American troops at risk when he used the Signal app to discuss military strikes in Yemen.

item.title: The Ashes are kickstarted at last by Mitchell Starc and Joe Root, but Australia's underbelly is tested
item.description: A day of tough, fluctuating Test cricket kickstarts the Ashes series at last as Mitchell Starc and Joe Root carry their sides despite concerns about what lies beneath.

item.title: What is shotcrete, the material that caused Sydney's M4 tunnel closure?
item.description: The issue with the commonly used substance caused delays where some motorists were gridlocked for more than 4 hours on Thursday morning.

item.title: A strong southerly change is forecast to sweep up the NSW coast from Saturday night to Sunday and drop temperatures up to 15C in 24 hours.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: A hot northwesterly airstream will send temperatures above 40C in a band from the northwest to eastern NSW during Friday and Saturday.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Heatwave stretches from Kimberley to Sydney as hot summer arrives
item.description: Just days into summer and a broad heatwave is already spreading across the country.
